meanings.definition: The state or position of being a primate
meanings.sent1: In the jungle, the primateships of the monkeys were evident as they swung from tree to tree.
meanings.sent2: The primateships of the gorillas in the zoo attracted many visitors.
meanings.sent3: The primateships of the chimpanzees led to some comical situations during feeding time.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style had the primateships of a wise orangutan, guiding her team with patience and strength.
meanings.sent5: The primateships of the baboons were unforgettable, their social hierarchy fascinating to observe.

meanings.definition: The office or rank of a primate
meanings.sent1: The primateships of the head gorilla were respected by all the other animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The primateships of the bishop were evident in the grand cathedral.
meanings.sent3: The primateships of the zookeeper were challenged when the mischievous monkeys escaped their enclosure.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself with the primateships of a queen, commanding attention wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The primateships of the CEO were unquestioned, his decisions shaping the future of the company.
